metadata.title: Wednesday, 11th July, 2012
metadata.session: FIRST SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    when the upgrading of the Mwinilunga-Jembe (T5) road to a bituminous standard will be completed;
(b)    when the Chibwika-Kamapanda road in Mwinilunga, which leads to Angola, will be rehabilitated; and
(c)    when the Makanu-Ntambu (D274) road in Mwinilunga Parliamentary Constituency will be rehabilitated.

questions.minister: Vice President when the current electoral regulations will be amended to improve the electoral process.
Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    whether the Zamtel College in Ndola has been privatised and, if so, who the new owners are;
(b)    what necessitated the transfer of the Zamtel Headquarters from Ndola to Lusaka; and
(c)    whether the transfer will be reversed.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication how Zambia ranks at the international level with regard to information communication technology for development purposes.
Minister of Foreign Affairs and Tourism
parts: (a)    how many local and foreign tourism operators there were in Zambia as of February, 2012;
(b)    how much revenue the Government realised from the operators at (a) above from January, 2010 to September, 2011;
(c)    what the major challenges for the local tourism operators are;
(d)    how the Government intends to address those challenges; and
(e)    whether the Government has any plans to encourage investment in the tourism sector in Lupososhi Parliamentary Constituency and, if so, what the plans are.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the construction of a 1 x 3 classroom block at Kamenyani Basic School, which stalled in 2009, will resume;
(b)    how much money was paid to the contractor who abandoned the project;
(c)    how much money will be spent on the project on completion; and
(d)    what the estimated time-frame for completing the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Foreign Affairs and Tourism when works on the Northern tourism circuit project will resume.
Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    why schools in rural areas are understaffed;
(b)    what measures the Government has taken to redress the situation;
(c)    why it is difficult for the Government to retain teachers in rural areas; and
(d)    whether Rural Hardship Allowance and Recruitment and Retention Allowances are still being paid to deserving teachers and, if not, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Foreign Affairs and Tourism
parts: (a)    whether the Ministry is aware that a lot of people have lost their lives due to crocodile attacks in Kabompo and Manyinga Rivers; and
(b)    when the reptiles will be cropped.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    what the progress on the Public-Private Partnership Agreement entered into between the Government and Thuthuka Group Limited of South Africa for the concessioning of Longacres Lodge under the Hostels Board of Management is;
(b)    whether the employees of Longacres Lodge will have the option to be redeployed;
(c)    who will pay the terminal benefits of the employees who opt to discontinue their employment with the Lodge; and

(d)    how much capital the Thuthuka Group Limited has invested in the venture. QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN ANSWER W30    Mr Mpundu (Nchelenge) - to ask the Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education:
(a)    what the performance of pupils at Grade 12 examination level at the following schools in Luapula Province was, from 2007 to 2011, year by year:
(i)    St Clement’s Secondary; and (ii)    Nchelenge Secondary;
(b)    what the total number of pupils who sat for the examinations in each year was; and
(c)    how many pupils obtained the following pass levels:
(i)    distinction; (ii)    merit; (iii)    credit; (iv)    pass/satisfactory; and
(v)    fail. W31    Dr Kazonga (Vubwi) - to ask the Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education:
(a)    how many qualifications were registered on the Technical Education, Vocational and Entrepreneurship Training Qualifications Framework as of January, 2012 at the following levels:
(i)    technologist; (ii)    technician; (iii)    craft; and (iv)    trade test; and
(b)    what measures the Government has taken to sensitise the following categories of people on the Technical Education, Vocational and Entrepreneurship Training Qualification Framework concept:
(i)    students; (ii)    trainers; (iii)    employers; and (iv)    parents and guardians.
